review.title: Hotel next to SF Museum.
review.reviewText: Walk to AT&T park.  Super comfortable mattress.  Tasteful rooms.  Garage entrance off of Howard St.

review.title: Preferred San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed at the W for my last two nights in SF just before a cross country relocation. Honestly, I didn't leave the hotel for one day, I was loving it so much. The Bliss Spa location was super convenient and the downstairs lounge called "the Living Room" was just that! I was able to relax with friends and food before heading out which was a great way to finish up in SF.
review.positiveRemarks: I love the W San Francisco for it's service, convenience, and its comfort.  The staff is always on point. The beds are heavenly.  It's easy to get to
review.negativeRemarks: The service at Trace is a little uneven. Sometimes it's great, sometimes it's a little inattentive.
review.locationRemarks: SF MOMA, Yerba Buena, and Moscone center are all close by.

review.title: Great central location
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this W many times and it never disappoints. Staff is alway great, rooms are delightfully comfortable, and it's close to many things.

review.title: 6 block walk to ATT Park, good restaurants nearby
review.reviewText:
Quick easy check in with WONDERFUL staff.
Sliding bathroom door was squeaky.
review.negativeRemarks: Queen beds instead of double beds would be more comfortable for 2 adults.
review.locationRemarks: Good location for ATT Park and Union Square shopping.

review.title: Nice hotel , updates needed in rooms
review.reviewText: Cute hotel , very busy location . It is right in the middle of all the hustle and bustle ... Which could be good if that's your thing . My only complaints are room service was horrible I just wasn't impressed with the food and the room that I was in was in major need of an upgrade !

review.title: weekend concert & shopping
review.reviewText: Super Convenient, friendly staff, rooms are clean & comfy, great gym and walking distance to ballpark, shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Very expensive for what you get!!!
review.reviewText:
Room was small. No pool / spa. Parking way over priced. Bar drink/food service was slow and very few healthy food choices in the bar.
Average at best!

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: Great location great service I find all the w's a great level of hotels

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: The hotel is perfectly located if you are visiting SFMOMA or for walking to AT&T stadium.  Also, I needed to get to Trader Joe's over on Bryant and waited in excess of 15 minutes for a bus but the Hotel has complimentary bicycles, helmets and locks so I borrowed one of their bikes and rode over to Trader Joes.  What a fantastic service to offer guests.  I loved my corner room with a comfy king-size bed.  The only bummer is that one night of my three night stay the room had carpet beetles but the hotel was quick to change out the bedding that night and treat the room the next day.  They offered to move me to another room but it was late at night and I was too tired to transfer to another room.  They were very accommodating though and very apologetic.  Otherwise my stay at the hotel was fantastic including having access to the business center and being able to print for FREE my boarding passes.
The condition of the room is not good, first two floors are a club, pretty noisy at midnight! Not worth the price of expensive hotel!

review.title: Nice hotel to stay at downtown. Close to market st
review.reviewText:
The trip started off as a nightmare because the airline lost our bags and it was so cold I was forced to spend a bunch of money on all new clothes for both my son and myself. 
The hotel staff was super nice but I had a nightmare with the airline in both ways.

review.title: Good hotel for business trip
review.reviewText: The hotel is good in OK location; stuff was friendly and supportive. For families there are other better options.

review.title: Nice spot to begin a visit
review.reviewText: Close to where we wanted to be and walking distance to restaurants.  Parking the rental car for two nights= OUCH

review.title: Nice hotel close to the Marconie
review.reviewText: Great hotel with a nice staff. Very clean and comfortable. The area is a bit boring, but worth it.

review.title: Excelent !!
review.reviewText: This hotel is close to everything.  Easy access and confortable
Hotel clean (except for carpeting; I suspect the vacuum used had not been cleaned recently), everything worked.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean the floors!
review.locationRemarks: Very central, especially to MOMA_ SF.

review.title: Modern amenities + benefits of a fanastic staff!
review.reviewText: Rooms are clean and comfortable,  well decorated but the jewel of this hotel is the staff! From the curbside check in to the front desk staff and the conseige, we couldn't of asked for better service! In the heart of the city, walking distance to Wharf area (about 4 miles)!

review.title: It's the W!
review.reviewText: Typical W modern hotel with a cool bar and lots of people frequenting it. The ne The rooms we're pretty good - not a huge fan of the carpet choice bit perfectly fine. Gym as cool looking and had the minimum of what was needed.

review.title: Great location!!
review.reviewText: Pretty hotel! We had a neat view of the Bay Bridge. Loved watching its light display at night. We walked pretty much everywhere we wanted to go. Giants game, China town, Fishernan's Wharf, etc.

review.title: Nice hotel in the middle of the big city.
review.reviewText: From check in to check out I had a great experience, hotel staff was there when you needed them and not in your face when you didn't. I had a pleasant experience and next time I go to the city I will probably stay at the W depending on the activities I will be doing.
review.positiveRemarks: The beds were almost too comfortable, I didn't want to get out of bed! But seriously, I was sleeping on a cloud.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing comes to mind.
review.locationRemarks: Go to pier 39 and fishermans warf, drive the little yellow cars around (GoCar) and explore the city! Ignore the homeless people!

review.reviewText: Unfriendly staff, old furnitures, rooms are not sound proof. Very noisy even late into night.

review.title: Run down rooms
review.reviewText: Carpet was dirty and staff were new an unprepared to answer questions.

review.title: Nice hotel in downtown
review.reviewText: Great Experience, great location in the middle of the city
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants, and shopping

review.title: Okay
review.reviewText: The rooms were fine but the noise from the bar which takes up most of the lobby was very off putting...as was the $62. per night fee for car parking.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice room amenities...soaps and bathroom particularly good.
review.negativeRemarks: Lighting in the rooms...very difficult for one person to read when the other would like to sleep
review.locationRemarks: Very good location.  Walking distance to AT &T ball park, movie theatres, BART station and restaurants

review.title: Nice hotel Excellwnt lobby bar lounge
review.reviewText: It's a W if you've stayed at another W hotel then you know what to expect. Great for people looking for convenience, fresh, modern and wonderful vibrant lobby bar/lounge with folks of different ages and backgrounds. If you're looking for a place to start your night and finish it this hotel offers that.

review.title: In town to go watch the Dodgers play
review.reviewText: Beautiful welcoming hotel staff and very clean. Was close to everything, walking distance to food,coffee, ballpark. Overall very happy with hotel and would book a room again in San Francisco.

review.title: Convenient to Moscone Center, pleasant atmosphere
review.reviewText: Did not spend too much time in the room but when I was there it was very comfortable.  Concierge was very helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: It is a perfect hotel for a vacationer as far as not being too distant from tourist sites and is great for a business trip held at Moscone center.
review.negativeRemarks: Outdoor patio/bar area

review.reviewText: Good hotel close to convention center and shopping area.

review.title: Beautiful lobby and restaurant. Room OK.
review.reviewText: Checked in and went to the room on the 16th floor. Front desk had not given us our breakfast coupons, location of restaurant or hours. Went back down to retrieve. Room was clean and seemed nice when we first arrived. We could hear a lot of loud noises after a while through to early morning and it never seemed to really cease. Realized on checkout we had been given a room right next to the supply maintenance room. Not much sleep.
review.positiveRemarks: Lobby, location, and restaurant. Restaurant had excellent food and service also. Highly recommend going here for a drink or food.
review.negativeRemarks: Service with some of the staff. I'm thinking some just aren't trained well.
review.locationRemarks: Close to restaurants, shopping, transportation. Great restaurant and bar within.

review.title: Too "hip" for me
review.reviewText: Was not aware of the young vibe of this hotel.  No in room coffee, no local news available, and clearly geared towards a 20 something traveler.  The room was quite small, but clean.  The lounge/restaurant had a DJ with very loud music.  No traditional tables or chairs for dining.  Had to pay for in-room Wi-Fi which is ridiculous in this day and age.  Probably very appealing to a 20 something traveler.  I would be reluctant to stay in another W property.

review.title: Great staff.
review.reviewText: The staff was very accomadating. They really were very helpful when we went sight seeing . The view from our room was amazing on the 21st.floor.

review.title: Rude, incompetent, and fraudulent
review.reviewText:
I arrived early and was promised to have the room ready by the check-in time stated in the contract: 3pm. At 3pm the room wasn't ready, and I was told it was because the hotel had been full the night before. I wasn't offered any compensation for the breach of contract; but when I said I'd write about this to TripAdvisor, the person at check-in, with a maddeningly fake smile offered drinks at the hotel bar, adding bribe to the list of the hotel's missteps. 

Upon check out, I was presented with a list of fraudulent charges at the minibar -- I hadn't consumed anything! Maybe a "present" to me because I had complained for the delay upon check-in? Anyway, thankfully the person at check-out was helpful and erased the charges as soon as I said I hadn't used the minibar.
review.negativeRemarks: Fewer people should make reservations. Then they won't be full any nights, and they'll be able to check their guests in at 3pm next day.
review.locationRemarks: It's in San Francisco, if you can't find anything to do nearby there's something wrong with you.

review.reviewText: Great location,  fast check in, overall wonderful experience
Great hotel.  A little club-ish, but all W's are....

Great location in Soma. Walking distance to Union square and there is a bus stop right there at the hotel. 

Bar and dining room was great, good food, drinks and service.

Beautiful hotel.
Only problem not enough storage for long stayed.

review.title: Wonderful property in the middle of it all!
review.reviewText: From my experience with the checking and process, to the courteous of the staff, to my overall general experience with this hotel was amazing!

review.title: Christmas Eve in SF
review.reviewText: Our room was comfortable with a nice view.  Loved the lighted clothes bar in closet.  Son enjoyed the hot Chocolate in lobby.  Our breakfast had many healthy options with greens.  The concierge set us up at a great restaurant -Lusk,  near ATT Park.
I enjoyed my stay at the W. Costumer service did a great job! Very welcoming and professional. The room was neat and clean!

review.title: Nice hotel, central to everything!
review.reviewText: Nice, central location. Lobby bar/restaurant area very chilly- turns into party scene friday/saturday nights. Concierge service was great, quiet room and very clean.

review.title: Very nice, accommodating hotel.
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very kind. Chic and hip hotel. The hotel is located in the heart of S.F. The hotel bar and lounge had many people, not too full, before we left for the night. Very trendy place to stay for millennials and others who enjoy a fun night out. Very glad we came here.

review.title: nice but not fantastic
review.reviewText: nice but not as nice as other W hotels around the world.

review.title: Mediocre
review.reviewText: Our room looked right onto the gigantic windowless wall of a neighboring skyscrapet some 20 feet away. Not very pleasant at all. Room was ok but nothing special

review.title: Great Hotel for a conference across the street.
review.reviewText: Good value for a short stay. I had to spend all day Monday at Moscone Center and the W was across the street. This was my first stay at a W hotel and it was very pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing .
review.locationRemarks: I only stayed long enough for a meeting and walk through at Moscone.

review.title: One NIght Stay at the W
review.reviewText:
Hotel staff was friendly and curtious. Very attentive. The first floor lounge/bar was rocking on Friday night. Our room was upgraded for free (and without asking) by check in hostess.

My only complaint is that after spending as much as we did at the hotel I think it is a little cheap to charge for overnight parking. I would think guests should get free parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Do not charge for overnight parking for guests
review.locationRemarks: Great place to stay if going to a Giant's game. Well within walking distance

review.title: Great Hotel. Room Service is WAY over priced
review.reviewText:
Loved this hotel and will stay there again. With that said, room service was insanely over priced. I ordered eggs, toast, and OJ. I got 2 eggs, one slice of bread cut in half, the equivalent to half a potato as home fries, and an orange juice... for $45!!! 

I could have gotten the same meal anywhere in the city for $10.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was great. Very friendly and helpful
review.negativeRemarks: Food costs.
review.locationRemarks: If you're going to the conference center, or spending time around Market street, this is a great location.

review.title: Downtown SF
review.reviewText: Very impressed with W hotel!  Room was small but clean.  Overall hotel was very stylish and chic. Only dissappointment was their parking fee. $56 daily valet with in& out previleges.  Looking foward to staying at another W hotel in the future!

review.title: Nice hotel close to shops
review.reviewText: Very nice, clean hotel with lovely staff. Close to shops and tram/bus stops. Nice bar/lobby area - fee for daily wifi though does have free wifi in lobby area!

review.title: My new hotel. They stole me from Staint Francis
review.reviewText: Amazing staff, amazing rooms and a great comfortable place that makes you feel at home. Staff was really helpful and i have to say they stole me as a customer from the Westin Staint Francis, which is another amazing hotel. Sorry to say but the W blew me away and stole their business. Thank you for everything to management and staff.
review.negativeRemarks: NOTHING
review.locationRemarks: Just went out for drinks and concert.

review.title: Great Hotel and Location
review.reviewText: Arriving at the hotel was a bit stressful. Friday afternoon, within blocks of the Giants stadium on game day,  and construction around the entrance. But a great hotel!

review.title: Great Location, Great hotel and Great Staff
review.reviewText: In town for the long weekend, the W was an excellent place to stay and I will return. The staff was very attentive to all matters, great location and close to downtown for shopping or ATT for a ballgame.  Everything was first class.

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is decorated to the 9's.We had abeautiful view of the city from our room facing south on the 30th floor.Staff is very friendly and helpful a sign of good management.Would recommend this hotel immensely.
review.positiveRemarks: The decorating, the food and the friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe a coffee pot in the room.Hard to carry two cups of coffee and work the card pass to the elevator.
review.locationRemarks: 5blocks to Union Plaza and 3 blocks to AMC theaters.Go see the Nest exhibit at the Target store.

review.title: Trendy and Comfortable San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: We returned to the W Hotel in San Francisco after a break of a few years.  The hotel is maintaining it's presence as a trendy and comfortable hotel that's nicely situated near the Moscone Convention Center.  The staff is attentive and the rooms and common areas are spotless.
review.locationRemarks: Short walk to Union Square and San Francisco's best shopping areas.  Check out the brunch at "The Grove", just around the corner from the hotel.

review.title: Friendly helpful staff. Nice hotel and amenities
review.reviewText:
Relaxing stay. Clean quiet room. Walking distance to AT & T Park.
Friendly staff and valets.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to pier areas

review.title: Nice modern Hotel next to Convention Center.
review.reviewText: Very nice modern well kept hotel.  Gym was very nice and liked the fact they provided super fresh filtered water.  Convenient location and close to Moscone.  Good value also ane nice bar/lounge.

Stayed for 4 nights....hotel is close to everything....no self-parking option, must valet. Good experience overall, bathroom door is semi-transparent which doesn't make sense. Location is great and center of everything. I would stay here again but ask to see if rooms exist with a different door. The staff is the best thing about this hotel....very accommodating, friendly, and will ensure your stay is pleasant.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff is extremely friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms.....there is a semi-transparent window on the bathroom door. Terrible.
review.locationRemarks: Lots to see and do, you are right in middle of everything.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Love the W brand; however, while the staff was top notch, this property is way behind in being styled and outfitted like most other W hotels I have visited.  Found the walls and hallway doors to be paper thin... could hear every bit of traffic in the corridors.
Great hotel, room had great view and was very clean. All staff were very professional...

review.title: Great hotel close to union square
review.reviewText: Staff were very helpful. Facilities are clean room is spacious all the essentials are covered well by the W

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I stayed here before the San Francisco Marathon with my husband and two kids.  We had a room with 2 queen beds.  The beds were nice and soft.  The Bliss bath products were great and the staff were very helpful.  The location cannot be beat.  Right near Yerba Buena Gardens.  Tons of restaurants and shopping all around.  Close to public transit or valet park your car for $54 + tax.  The room was a bit dated, but signs said a renovation is ongoing, so that will probably be fixed soon.  The ambiance and rooms were just not child-friendly.  I felt like I was in Vegas or at a nightclub.  There was an unreal liquor selection in the room, plus multiple bars in the hotel.  Everything had odd little tags with "hip" sayings or slogans on them.  I felt really old and I'm 32.  The room was also small, very small.  So small that the only place to put up the pack-n-play was between the closet and the foot of the bed, which made getting in the closet or to the bathroom a challenge.  There was also a bunch of overpriced candy in the room to tempt my children.  Ugh.  I think I would have loved this hotel if I was staying with girlfriends, but with kids, not so much.
review.positiveRemarks: Location.  Staff was very helpful and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Better use of space in rooms.  No need for bench seat adjacent to window or odd footmassager beneath desk that prevented chair from being pushed in

review.title: Modern hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, it's very modern and the workers are nice. When we were leaving the maid said "good morning, have a great day today." That was nice. The only bad part was they didn't have wifi in the rooms unless you sign up for their program. I signed up for the program online and still could not get the free wifi. I believe hotels should just have free wifi for their guests.

review.title: Great Hotel and Staff!
review.reviewText: The rooms are very clean and nice!  The staff is very friendly.  But note that the lobby/bar area is pretty much a night club in the evenings.  Loud music and lots of people, so if you're looking for a quiet place to have a drink and relax in the evening, don't go here.  But if you are up for it, the atmosphere is great!
review.locationRemarks: we stayed here because it was a short drive from AT&T park.

review.title: Was hoping for more...Smiles everyone, smiles!
review.reviewText:
Took a quick trip to catch Giants game.  Hotel is very well situated amongst the hub of SF.  Great area.  
The courtesy of staff was mixed.  The people we dealt with face to face (concierge, etc) were for the most part friendly and were all helpful with our questions.  They were not out of their way friendly, though, which is always a nice plus.
We found the king sized bed a bit lumpy to be honest - woke up with some back pain.

review.title: Construction
review.reviewText: Had a frustrating time- due to loud construction at the SF moma at 830 in morn. They did move me...but I missed out on sleeping in....
Great Location! We loved the room and the gym was amazing.

Was not the best of hotels I stayed. Rooms are clean but over charging on the little things. Most hotels would at least offer free bottles of water. However, here they charge $5. Service was not prompt as it should. And even though for several days I walked by the same doorman, on my day of check out, he asked me if I was checking-in or out.

review.title: Close to AT&T park
review.reviewText: Loved the convenience of the hotel. Very nice place!!

The room assigned to me (1006) was very dark. The lights in the room either did not work
or they were not properly positioned.

Basically, the only place were there was enough light was the bathroom.

The toilet ran all the time ( valve does not shut properly), so it was bothering.

I honestly did not have time to report it because I had a very busy schedule and
did not feel like changing room.
review.negativeRemarks: NA

review.title: Business stay
review.reviewText: Great rooms, staff, hotel. Business center not used much, but great staff make up for this. Great location if going to Moscone center.

review.title: Way too expensive for what it offers
review.reviewText: The entrance is tiny to say the least, always easily crowded to the point that is it hard to walk through.  The place is super expensive without reason; even their restaurant, has few choices, has a pretense of fancy, it's expensive ($40 for a breakfast, really?) and is really not up to the promise.  Overall the only thing that saves it is its location, across the street from the Mosconi center.  But there are lots of less expensive yet still very nice hotels a little further.
review.negativeRemarks: Use bottom floor entirely for bar, move restaurant to 2nd floor, make room, space, air!!!  Make it less oppressive.  And more gym equipment
review.locationRemarks: This is the business area of SF.  If you are not there for business, go somewhere else.

review.title: Last Minute Stay
review.reviewText: I had an easy time checking booking the room due to a last minute situation. When I got to the hotel, the room was already for me. Everything about it was convenient and quick.
review.positiveRemarks: One of my favorite hotels in SF. I like the layout of the rooms, the toiletries, the location, and the vibe.

review.title: Great friendly staff
review.reviewText: I was greetd by very friendly staff. Great room. Awesome stay.

review.title: Solid choice
review.reviewText:
Overall, I had a positive experience. The check in process was fast and efficient. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. My room had very poor sound insulation, which was a minor irritant. Had my neighbors been louder, it would have been a more significant concern. 
The hotel is well located and the staff was attentive. There is a lively bar scene, which is nice but can lead to slightly disheveled public spaces in the morning. They did a good job of cleaning the public spaces as the day progressed. 
Again, I had an overall positive experience. With some tweaks, this could be an outstanding hotel. I would stay again.

review.title: Tired asset with uneven staff quality
review.reviewText: Let's start with the arrival. The hotel is located on a busy street, with limited access to a tiny valet access. The access was first blocked by a limo, causing me to wait in double line while said limo moved, only to be replaced by a U-Haul van. I took me getting out of my car and asking him what to do for him to even acknowledge me, only to tell me that in fact, this was the valet access AND CONTINUE TO CHAT WITH THE U HAUL DRIVER WHO WAS BLOCKING THE ACCESS. Enervated, I backed up in order to squeeze in within the tiny space the U Haul truck left, without any aid of the chatty valet guy. This whole time, my 7 years old was waiting with my wife in the car, eager to get into the hotel after a long drive. I backed up and moved forward at least 5 times in order to squeeze in the opening left by the truck, and eventually pulled trough, but not without scratching my car in the process (barricade on the street). When I complained furious about the attitude of the hotel guy on the street (STILL CHATTING at this point with the truck driver), I was told by the valet attendant that they are sorry. The bus boy was extremely helpful and after escorting us to our room, promised to follow up on my complaint. I did in fact get a message later in the day from the valet supervisor (the guy on the street) telling me "he told me not to try to get in (a blatant lie)" and "that if it is a rental, the credit card should cover the damage" - not a word of apology! The room was clean.
review.positiveRemarks: The busboy, and the quality of the food (not the service) in the restaurant. Tried reservation at 7:30, told only 7:45 was available,  resto was empty
review.negativeRemarks: The valet supervisor should be either demoted or fired for both his attitude and sense of ethics. The room should be updated (leaky battery in radio)
review.locationRemarks: If you like noisy and urban - this is for you. Dining options nearby are populated by downtown professionals. Lunch is extremely busy

review.title: Midst of everything.  Close to moscone centers.
review.reviewText: Quiet except for techno music in lobby.  Not too loud though. Coffee in lobby in am

review.title: Close to centre of town. Nice place
review.reviewText: Good experience. Would recommend. Stayed there twice in a few weeks. Nice place with a good atmosphere.
I stayed at the W as I was in town for a convention and the location was ideal for ensuring a very short commute as well as convenient location to great places to eat.

review.title: good place
review.reviewText: great. Hotel. Stay there. Very cool places. Worth the doe.

review.title: Centrally located, but disappointed with hotel
review.reviewText: We loved the fact that the hotel was centrally located and close to everything -streetcars, subway, etc..Did not find the hotel staff helpful, and found the hotel itself run-down - cramped lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff could be more accomodating and hotel overall could use a spruce-up
review.locationRemarks:
things to do nearby: museum of modern art, all the great shopping + boutiques are steps away.
easy access to trams to reach the piers/waterfront.

review.title: PARKING RATES
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice, also the location is at walking distance from downtown. What I do not like about Expedia or the hotel is that I was never informed about the $50 plus dollars per day for parking, I think that type of practices of doing bussines are not honest personally I was disappointed. Also, I believe that the hotel is animal friendly and there where dogs everywhere, maybe they sleep in my bed the night before, you could here them in the aisle, not the room but I think you should know that. Finally, please do not miss understand what I am about to say but, I saw a lot of gay couples and if you are taking your family with you, be prepare to explaind to them why "boys" are kising in the elevator even in the precence of the little ones, finally the music is annoying the secon day, to electronic for me.
review.positiveRemarks: the restaurant is very good, the Chilaquiles in the morning are great!
review.negativeRemarks: NO ANIMALS, NOT SO MUCH ELECTRONIC MUSIC
review.locationRemarks: LOCATION IS VERY GOOD

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel and close to many amazing places for visiting.

review.title: Great location. Accessible to all attraction
review.reviewText:
Hotel is at walking distance to all attraction. 
Staff is super nice and accommodating. We came as a group of three families and were accommodated with rooms next to each other. 
The bar and fire place are very cosy yet modern design. 
Breakfast at restaurant was great. 
The bliss spa is as good as NY with professional great technicians.
The only draw back are the beds which are not very comfortable, way too soft. We all walk up every morning with a back pain but I guess that's why they have a spa in house. 
Will definitely go back to this hotel

review.title: Nice hotel. Excellent location.
review.reviewText: We had a great weekend. The views from the room was really nice especially during the night. The food at the cafe was pricey but very good.

review.title: Superb location
review.reviewText: Great location & service. Carpet, bath fixtures, blinds needed update/repairs. Coffee/tea maker in the room would be really nice.

review.title: Loved, loved, loved it!
review.reviewText:
I want my own hotel some day, I'm a Chef in the business, I have had the privilege of traveling all over the world and stayed at some of the best! I was alone in San Francisco at the end of a fantastic holiday with my friends on the beautiful west coast,  and I have to say the W hotel was by far the best stop on my journey. I'm taking decorating tips from the beautiful room.  I had a great day on the piers and a fantastic facial at the hotel. To top it all off I had the ultimate Californian experience with an earth quake at 3am in the morning!  Great people beautiful hotel, I stayed at the Palace the night before, it reminded me of " the shining"  no mini bar unless you are in a suite! hate that... went down to the bar for the signature cocktail it was terrible and the staff treated me like a shoplifting teenager. 
So I'm going to be in New York on the 5th to the 11th of January, couldn't convince my friend to spend the little bit more to stay with you, but I will try and make it a spot to stop by and enjoy the Bliss Spa. 
Thank you, Lisa McCullough.
The bathroom doors are sliders that do not fully close. Very strange.
review.negativeRemarks: Fix the doors on the bathroom so they seal out noise like a normal door. Add a fan...something!

review.title: The place to be when in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The staff here are very professional and make sure to meet the visitors need.

review.title: Nice hotel close to down town
review.reviewText: Liked the hotel, friendly staff. Enjoyed my vication

review.title: Fantastic San Francisco location.
review.reviewText: Loved this cool and modern hotel. I've been to the Bliss spa many times, but never stayed at the hotel before. We absolutely loved our stay.

review.title: Very nice modern hotel in SF
review.reviewText: Great ambiance and clean room. Can be a little noisy but overall very worth the price.

review.title: Trendy hotel, great location
review.reviewText: My husband and I have stayed here several times and each time we are guaranteed a clean, nice room with a very comfortable bed. The staff is always very courteous and the bar is the coolest!

review.title: Very nice hotel... close to shopping and downtown
review.reviewText: Exactly what I expected. Great experience. I felt that the staff wanted our stay to be a great one. Prompt, efficient, ready to help. Nice lounge and lobby.
review.positiveRemarks: modern decor, clean, great staff, great location
review.negativeRemarks: Free wifi. All hotels should get rid of the mini bars and provide guests with a empty fridge.
review.locationRemarks: Close to downtown... walking distance to shopping, food entertainment.

review.title: It's a party room but not really good for family
review.reviewText: Me and my husband stay at W hotel for two nights and I have a female emergency and they didn't have the product at the room and it was really late at night. And the phone in my room was not working. My husband had a hackthon going on for two days and three nights. So I was alone. There are too much alcohol in the room but no family supply. I feel I don't want to stay in this hotel anymore.

review.title: Beautiful hotel!
review.reviewText: We were just in town one night for the last Giants game.  We were treated well, the room was comfy, the food at Trace was good, and the bar was fun.  We were especially impressed with the concierge service - one of the reasons I love the Starwood Hotels.
review.positiveRemarks: I like that every possible device charger is available in the room!
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of a thing.
review.locationRemarks: Close to BART, AT&T Park, and Union Square.  Lots of shopping and dining close by.

review.title: Beautiful and convenient hotel
review.reviewText: Had a weekend getaway for 3 days and had an amazing experience with the hotel. The bench in the Spectacular room is very comfortable and a great idea. Location is great for shopping and a Giants game.

review.title: I wouldn't stay again...
review.reviewText:
There was never a doorman to open a door.  We had to lug our bags in ourselves.  We used the lobby restroom after breakfast on a Monday morning and it was covered in vomit from the night before and smelled like it.  The front desk did apologize and when I got an email from the manager asking for any feedback or concerns I emailed him.  I gave him a week to respond and never received one.  

My coworker's daughter happened to check in to the W that same weekend and when she saw her tiny room immediately checked out and went to another hotel in the area.  I wish I would have had that option because I would have been out of there.

We had to wait 15 minutes to get a drink on a not busy night at the bar too!
review.positiveRemarks: The cookies from room service and the coffee.
review.negativeRemarks: The cleanliness of the lobby bathroom.  Someone to open the door.  All the other hotels had one.
review.locationRemarks: Wasn't the best location, didn't do much near the hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel but strange decor.
review.reviewText: Coffee was out in the lobby in the morning so I let them know. Instead of making more they just put it away. For a $300 a night room a free cup of coffee isn't a lot to ask for. Especially since there isn't a coffee maker in the room.

review.title: Great hotel close to the convention center
review.reviewText: The experience was wonderful, I would stay in this hotel again

review.title: Nice trendy hotel great location
review.reviewText:
Trendy hotel for trendy guests.
Centrally located and easy to reach from 3rd street exit.
Very friendly and helpful staff.
Car parking expensive

review.title: Cleanness part of san Fransico
review.reviewText: Staff bent over backwards to make our stay and experience exceptional .

review.title: W hotel downtown
review.reviewText: The staff were excellent and very accommodating for my needs. I had to change rooms and they included a breakfast voucher and free internet. The room and experience were too notch.

review.title: Good location for games
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice but the experience was horrible. We ordered room service and the French fries tasted and felt like they had been cooked three different times. At midnight we were woken up by a flood of water coming through a light fixture in the bathroom, sending the maintenance people in and out for the next thirty minutes and they thought a nice compensation was to buy us breakfast.... Are you kidding?? I'm in the service industry and they should have comped the room or at least the next stay. Not only will I not go back but I will never use Expedia again as this is the third horrible experience through this website.
review.negativeRemarks: Service, food, offered products, and it's obvious that the hotel needs a facelift
review.locationRemarks: Baseball games aren't far, there is a close park and union square is close.

review.title: Nice happening hotel!
review.reviewText: Great location and happening place too. Room is very nice as well as the entire hotel.

review.title: W hotel DT San Fran
review.reviewText: Very enjoyable, clean, modern, organic food available as well
Smaller than expected for the price. They couldn't get us the room we booked on expedia ( king room). They have us a dual full instead.

review.title: Ok hotel. No parking, no internet, no breakfast.
review.reviewText: Expensive hotel for their facilities. No free internet, no free parking (no self parking and nobody from staff dont know where to park), no free breakfast. I didnt like. Nice room thought.

review.title: Disappointing for the price!
review.reviewText: It was a comfortable room but no where near the $650.00 I paid for one night. I would have expected a suite at that price point. There was some sort of construction going on which i though was in the hotel which went on past 7pm. I called twice about this and i was told it was stopped but it still continued. The hotel said it was next door but i wasn't even on the top level and i could hear it through my bathroom fan. It ended up giving me such a headache that i left and when returning after 10pm it had finally stopped. I would not stay here again unless the price point was under $200 a night.
review.negativeRemarks: Room updating and customer service
review.locationRemarks: Location was great being that it was right next door to the convention center.

review.reviewText:
We had a girls weekend in the City and stayed at the W.
The staff recommended Blue Bottle Coffee and I must say that recommendation made my whole weekend.
The "W' is Awesome.

review.title: Great hotel for Pride!!
review.reviewText: It was a great hotel although the construction dampened the mood a bit. Would love to come back once the construction is done :)

review.title: Beautiful contemporary dining room
review.reviewText: As I mentioned in the title, dining room is exceptionally nice. Unfortunately it is the only highlight. Hotel is very dark. For the price of $400 per night I did not expect the small, sad tub. One that one can find in "Best Western" perhaps. I know, it's the location of course and the proximity to Moscone Center that elevates the price. I will not stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText: Didnt even feel like a hotel room, felt more as if we were staying at a super clean college room with all it's amenities....the little desk, bedded section by the window with great view of the city...and many more! Would definitely recommend!

review.title: Overall, W a good weekend visit.
review.reviewText:
Great ambiance
Room was a little warm and thermostat didn't seem to have any effect
No coffee in room, had to go to lobby
Fitness center in temp location due to renovation
Overall extremely pricey. In room snacks, drinks priced out of sight. Bring your own goodies!
Room service food was disappointing. Way too much salt and poor preparation (just warmed up frozen food?!)

review.title: Construction
review.reviewText: Lot next door under construction. Literally had construction workers working directly outside my 11th floor window first thing in the morning. "Gym" is currently a bizarre tented/plastic walled in temp space in the 4th floor rooftop space... open directly on the construction work and workers in the lot next door.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Love the hotel room, window seat in the room, great view ...
Staff at the front desk was very professional and friendly...
Only down fall was the gym facility not operational...

review.title: Nice staff, didn't meet our needs
review.reviewText: I would recommend they supply complimentary coffee pots to each room and free wifi.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Everything's good except the construction nearby. Staff was nice and friendly. Room was good and cute. Oh one more thing is you need call valet service 15 mins before when you use your car.
review.negativeRemarks: Wish there were self parking structure.
review.locationRemarks: Good location to use public transportation

review.reviewText: Great service. GunWoo went above and beyond in customer service!

review.title: W Hotel, DT San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Excellent service, good location!

However, need improve room cleanliness, especially the Shower Tower need to be replaced. Looks yellowish!!! Just for future guests reference, DT overnight parking is really expensive. Take consideration when you booking DT hotel.

Overall, nice hotel!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Please replace the Shower Tower.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping DT sightseeing Lots food choices

review.reviewText: Hotel staff was great! They upgraded our room for free and gave us a free ride in the hotel Denali to our dinner reservations.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, but way too much techno/dub step.
review.reviewText:
Our room was lovely, the staff was very friendly and accommodating; however, you cannot escape the constant stream of techno/dub step music being played by their in-house dj and generally. The music is in the lobby, the elevator, the bar, outside of the hotel and most unfortunately, it was piping into our room (I think through the air vent from the floor above) between 4-6 am on a Saturday.

The most disappointing part, was we were there to celebrate our 13 year anniversary. We should have done some research about this place before booking it on appearances alone. I will definitely try to find a much quieter hotel next time we're in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Better/less music in common areas. Add coffee makers to the individual rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, near the Yerba Buena Gardens and close access to public transportation.

review.title: super cool hotel
review.reviewText: rooms are little bit smaller than pictures but cool and great hotel , so much fun
review.positiveRemarks: if u stay here for weekend , u dont need to go out , stay in hotel , place is rolling
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: great location , close everywhere and safe

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel for a weekend stay. No pool and limited gym was a little annoying. Enjoyed how lively the lounge was. Great for young couples on weekend trips like us.

review.title: Disappointing W Hotel
review.reviewText:
Only Hotel's name is "W". The rest regarding room comfort & design is very horrible and disappointing. Room is very old, no interior architecture, furnitures are bad. Bed is very unfomfortable.

This hotel should not represent W Brand as it gave me the experience and feeling of a cheap hotel room!
Unfortunately, the amount that I paid to this hotel is a total waste of money. When I gave the feedback to the people in hotel they also agreed about room conditions.

This terrible hotel changed my W perception.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms and Design Interior Architecture Furnitures such as TV, Room electronics, Bed...
review.locationRemarks: Located in city center

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel! We had a great time and would stay there again

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Loves it. Super friendly staff. Hip, but still good with kids

review.title: Overpriced & Overrated
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, but I really expected something more luxurious for what we were paying. The lobby area was cute but small, nothing like the grand entrance of the W in LA. Our room was nicely decorated and clean, but tiny. The bathroom doors are completely see-through and don't close all the way, so if you are not totally comfortably with the people you are staying with, this is not the place for you. $60/night for parking and $14 for wi-fi. Really? I did, however, appreciate the complimentary Bliss toiletries and comfy mattresses/bedding.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortably beds, nice decor, Bliss products in room
review.negativeRemarks: Change the bathroom doors and make Wi-fi free!

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Great service I would go back, recommend that people stay here for the great service, awesome bar!

review.title: Amazing beds, horrible staff
review.reviewText: The beds are about the only thing we would consider returning for. Everything is way overpriced & the room service manager had no idea how to deal with a customer complaint. No one dealt with my issue & didn't comp anything. Terrible customer service!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Always nice place to stay ! Would recommend this hotel to friends.found all it's amenities to be great and found it easy to get to . At arrival the staff was very helpful .

review.title: Where the hip kids stay
review.reviewText: Staff are helpful. W is a consistent and SF lives up. Solid location, near lots.

review.title: Good choice

review.title: Great hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: This is a modern, hip, fun, luxurious hotel! It has a fun, hopping lobby! The staff is very friendly and accommodating! Our room was very comfortable and we had a great view of the Bay Bridge.
review.locationRemarks: Across the street from SFMOMA!

review.title: too small for the price
review.reviewText: and parking is NOT included, you'll either have to park on your own (like in public parking) or vallet ($60 per day)

We've thoroughly enjoyed our stays in W Hotels in other cities.
W SF is highly overrated … poor location, indifferent service at bar/restaurant & interior design very "edgy".
We travel to SF twice per year and will never stay at this W again.
review.locationRemarks: Poor location. No tourist attractions nearby thus long walks to shopping, restaurants and civic attractions.

review.negativeRemarks: Rooms were nice and comfortable but the overall feeling was that it could use some paint touchups here and there. It felt a little bit worn out.
review.locationRemarks: Great location! Easy to walk from.

review.reviewText: The only bad experience was I had to wait in line to check out for about 10 min. For the price of the rooms nobody should have to wait in any lines at this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The first time I entered the room there was a very pleasant scent.

review.title: Very close to convention center.
review.reviewText: Very close to concention center (Moscone Center). Literally a block away. Hotel was clean, business posh, not worth the $650 a night i paid for the conference i had to attend. Quite frankly not worth anything over $300 a night. I dont see the value in it. The W's in miami and ny are far better. Eventhough my job picked up the tab for this hotel, i still feel it wasnt worth the money.

review.title: W San Fran
review.reviewText: Staff was great. The Acura car they used to give us a ride to warf was really nice and the driver was super! Hotel lobby and bar were very nice. Room needed to be updated. View of bay was nice too. Parking a bit too expensive. Over $50 per night.

review.title: AMAZING hotel
review.reviewText: The staff is amazing, the food at Trace was amazing, the hotel is gorgeous. Overall, we had a great stay @ the W.

review.title: Avoid room next/close to elevator
review.reviewText: I arrived late due to a business reason, I just went straight to the room after checkin an hour before midnight. However, the room I got is located at the corner and is very close to an elevator, which is awful. I can hear the noise from elevator every other 5 minutes from my bed. But since I am too tired and really want to save time on rest, I didn't request to change room. If anyone book this hotel, I would recommend to ask if the room is close to elevator before you accept the room during checkin. I probably won’t stay in this hotel unless my company pay for it again.

review.title: modern hotel
review.reviewText: Is a very stylish hotel, optimal for business travelers and couples.

review.title: Nice place to stay.
review.reviewText: Went for our 20th yr anniversary trip to San Fran/Napa. Hotel was nice and the Acura experience was great.
review.negativeRemarks: extend hours of Acura experience.
review.locationRemarks: Location was fine

review.title: 70s Holiday Inn decor in rooms
review.reviewText: Just not pleasing to the senses. NONON ONOONOOONO.
review.negativeRemarks: Decor.

review.title: Reliable Stay

review.title: nice hotel for business trips

The only two things that are not up to standard of the W hotel is the cleaningness of the pool and the MUSIC IN THE LOBBY IS TERRIBLE! HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE of the lobby and the bar just because of the MUSIC!
review.positiveRemarks: It is a good, clean hotel, happily situated.
review.negativeRemarks: SPA services, music in the lobby and bar

review.title: Fantastic hotel experience

review.title: Giants game overnight ear
review.reviewText: Rooms were very comfortable and well stocked with accesories, bar, gadgets and tech gear to support most electronics. Almost to the point of being excessive (so much stuff that it looked crowded and made it hard to pack up the next day without thinking you left something behind hidden amongst all the stuff. Lol) Excellent bath products.

review.title: Top Notch
review.reviewText: The W is my favorite place to stay in San Francisco, hands down. The first/second floor bar is wonderful, and the staff and rooms are consistently excellent. It's also generally not full of tourists or families which makes it more pleasant for the yuppie & business crowds.

review.title: Best hotel ever!
review.reviewText: All the staff was very accommodating. I have been on crutches and the staff went out of there way to help me when I needed. Running to get the door for me and all very friendly. The room was comfortable and nicely kept. Beds were quite comfortable and everything was great. The spa was extraordinary!! I recommend all of their services! The whole experience was great I had stayed at a different hotel prior in union square and it was not nearly as nice or accommodating. It was a great stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff- all very friendly and accommodating. Helpful and kind to me on crutches.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: It was near everything. Lots of shopping and china town.

review.title: Great hotel near SFMOMA
review.reviewText: Hotel is great, I was upgraded with beautiful views of the bridge. Walking distance to museums, shopping, great restraunts.

review.title: super hip hotel
review.reviewText: great service. super cool hotel. close to everything.

review.title: Funky Place
review.reviewText: Cool hotel,hip and fun.Great stay,cozy room and great area of the city.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: The hotel is stunning. The location is perfect. Right next to MOMA and in walking distance to union square. We had a beautiful view of the bay bridge. Very romantic. We will be back :)

review.title: convenient business hotel
review.reviewText:
nice king-sized bed in room of average size with somewhat interesting view of moscone ctr. room absolutely quiet, organized well with all amenities anyone would need. location is absolutely safe, hotel security excellent. desk staff attentive and efficient. bathroom nice, good hot water, good shower. sink is poorly designed (blame manufacturer) with faucet too far in the way of bowl. bed very comfortable, good mattress. slept well. good storage for items. good light control, air conditioning not loud. enough outlets. only rough spot was getting late room cleaning one day: not done. very trendy restaurant on street floor, loud, with DJ. a.m. coffee service ended quite early, but coffee was good. one of us had a meal in restaurant, delicious. very receptive and helpful storing luggage after checkout. we did not use garage, but parking is available.

location near many restaurants, easy walk to embarcadero, to BART. also not too far walk to Caltrain station (about 1 km). shopping in Union square is also convenient, as is terminus of Powell St cable car for tourists. near a lot of shopping, both major chains and high-end specialty stores on Maiden Lane and surroundings. for culture, new SF Jazz Center is a hop on any market st trolley to civic center, also there the Asian Museum and symphony/opera houses. also via N-Judah trolley access to Golden Gate park and de Young museum, arboretum, conservatory, and science museum
review.negativeRemarks: sink design
review.locationRemarks: easy to get there off I-80 bay bridge first offramp going west or from south. right next to SF Mus Contemp Art and across street from Moscone ctr

review.title: Excellent!!!
review.reviewText:
Excellent experience
Staff was great and everything was perfect

review.title: Romantic, party , trendy
review.reviewText: The hotel was trendy and modern. The room was very clean. The staff were extra helpful
review.locationRemarks: Area was nice lots of restaurants and easily accessible

review.title: SF W, probably not a good choice for grown-ups
review.reviewText: The SF W has returned to its early buzz as a gathering place for party-goers. By 5 in the afternoon until very late, the lobby, bar and restaurant is very crowded and very loud. Forget about using this as a meeting place for business or friends if you want to hear them. I made the mistake of volunteering for the environmentally sensitive program of no routine replacement of towels and sheets. What I did not realize was that this meant no housekeeping at all and I was there for six days. They responded quickly when I asked for housekeeping, but delivered this with a snitty voicemail indicating that I had no followed through with the "clean choice" initiative. No indication of apology at their failure to explain that you are on your own regardless of the length of the stay. Just a bad tone to the contact. Also, the TV service was very, very poor. You could never receive more than one network channel and that was unreliable. I don't know if they contracted for some cheaper cable package or what, but really poor service on that.

review.title: Dissappointing
review.reviewText:
The room was sparsely furnished with just the bed and a single desk chair. (No armchair or sofa)

Coffee facilities not provided as standard in the room, and I had to ask twice before they were finally sent up on my second day there. Coffee supplies not replenished until I asked for them.

Overall disappointing.
review.positiveRemarks: Location... close to Moscone and the conference I was attending
review.negativeRemarks: The room

review.title: $15 for internet access
review.reviewText: $15 per day for for internet access? Unacceptable. Otherwise a very nice hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: $15/day for internet access

review.title: Great downtown hotel
review.reviewText: Got a free upgrade, nicely appointed rooms and love the bliss bath products. Only negative was poorly made cocktails at the lounge. Wish location was not directly in front of moscone

review.title: Great hotel for young people.

review.negativeRemarks: No free wifi

review.title: Great place to crash after a night boozing
review.reviewText: I always stay at the W Hotel whenever I head into the city for an evening. It's the nicest downtown hotel I've seen and while expensive, it's never outrageous. If you check in late, you usually get upgraded.

review.title: Hotel feels like a club
review.reviewText: It would have been nice to have parking included but everyone was super nice. The place was clean, it felt like a club and the bed was comfy.
review.negativeRemarks: the parking is expensive
review.locationRemarks: Its tough to find the parking garage but you will find it if you drive around a couple times

review.title: What an awesome hotel!
review.reviewText: It was nice to be pampered. From the moment I got there, everything about the hotel just seems luxurious.The Staff was courteous and knowledgeable. The best part is the location. I was in town for a function within one block, it was nice just to be able to walk there. I want to find anther reason to come back!

review.title: Modern Hotel and good location
review.reviewText: A really nice environment, totally a different experience from any other hotel i've ever been. Is not that is luxurious is just modern but classy.

review.title: Nice hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Good hotel. Close to everything. Good environment and great rooms.

review.title: not as anticipated
review.reviewText:
We were disappointed in our stay at the W..perhaps had higher hopes..
Still amazed that hotels can charge $15. per day for Wi Fi. We were able to negotiate a better rate; in that way the manager was helpful.
Very busy upon arrival at night and difficult to hear at check in but improved in the morning
Inconsistent staff: some very helpful and some much less so..
Hope I haven't hit cranky old lady status yet but might be better suited to the 30-40 yr old crowd
review.locationRemarks: good location..right next door to sf museum and walking distance everywhere..

review.title: Dressed to impress
review.reviewText: Hotel is hard to find. One black "W" sticking out of the corner of the building might be chic but not practical. Entrance to parking is even worse and the cost per day is $50 plus tax. Got one bar of soap over 3 night stay. Elevator requires door card/key which may be for security but is a pain when you are holding anything. Room is certainly tastefully decorated if somewhat smaller than the suburban place we stayed previously. Glass bathroom door offers little privacy. The fact that it slides means that using the toilet during the night wakes up everyone in the room - again chic but not practical. Water gets good and hot but shower flow is really slow. Bed was very comfortable. Television offered lots of choices. Room service was good. Food was hot and delivery prompt and friendly. Bellhop was also helpful. Firehouse next door can disturb sleep, but being across from Moscone Center is convenient. In house restaurant was very good. Concierge's recommendation for Tadich Grill was a good one.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Convenient

review.title: Great - clean hotel
review.reviewText: In room food service is pricey. Take advantage on hotel complimentary car shuttle service, we reserved the car 3 times and that probably saved us at least $100 in cab fare!
review.positiveRemarks: Complimentary car shuttle service, reserve in advance thru front desk.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive in room food service! Too many fees and added gratuity!

review.negativeRemarks: n/a

review.title: Overall good hotel

review.title: Great if you are looking for a constant party
review.reviewText: As a business traveler, I wished this hotel had more amenities like an easy to access business center. This hotel is overpriced however considering their "visionary" design of the guest rooms look like an Ikea showroom. It's a great place if you are young and looking to party. If you are on business, at a convention, generally tired? The pounding noise and crowds of the lobby bar will irritate.
review.positiveRemarks: rooms were immaculate and the staff was very well trained.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy, crowded, a little pretentious

review.title: Pleasant stay
review.reviewText:
The hotel was nice and in a good location however i was a little disappointed with the set up of the bar and the restaurant as i thought from the pictures these were in seperate locations but instead they were all on one floor that appeared too squashed. I wasnt too happy with our view which was of a building site and also they dont offer free internet to hotel guests which i think is rediculous. There were also a lot of famalies staying which i though was a little odd as it doesnt give the impression of a family hotel (perhaps it is). Also from the pictures i though the pool area was nicer than it actually was-was a tiny pool and not as glamourous as the pictures displayed

However our overal time there was pleasing and the staff were very friendly and helpful. the location is great as there are a lot of cool bars tucked away and is about 10 min from chinatown and another 10 from north beach. we had a pleasant stay but im not sure i would stay there again

No internet
set up of the bar and restaurant
tiny pool

review.title: Definitely W on the next trip

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: Super modern, trendy, & posh. Staff was very friendly & helpful. Conveniently located within minutes of market street (cable car transit).

review.title: Great hotel and location in the heart of DT SF

Great place to stay. Great location.

If you want a place thats close to everything and you like your hotel modern ...this would be a great pick.
