review.title: W Hotel
review.reviewText:
great hotel! excellent staff and very good restaurant

perhaps music in lobby just a little too loud in early evening when guests wanting to relax a little.

could hear noise of lifts from our room which was a little annoying
review.negativeRemarks: noise of lift that we could hear from our room
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: Like!
review.reviewText: This hotel was super quite and the elevator was really fast. Loved it, would stay there again,

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: The location was great as we were going to see the Giants at AT@T park. As we Were there just prior to the USOpen we were fortunate to run into Jim Furyk who was staying at the hotel and who was a true gentleman to chat with.

review.title: Truly Amazing!
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the W hotel during the long Memorial Day weekend (May 25 - 28), and it was simply amazing! The hotel staff was great, they were at our disposal for any little request, and no request was too small or too big! I felt like we were treated like gold! A few examples to list:
- We asked if we can move our room to a higher floor, and the young gentleman (Nick?) moved us without reservation and without additional charge!
-It was pouring outside so my boyfriend had asked the young lady at the front desk if she had an extra umbrella, and she handed him two, for FREE!
-After a long day of sightseeing, we walk into our hotel to find free samples of alcoholic goodness being passed around! (There was always complimentary water available and hot coffee in the mornings)
- Lastly, we got so sunburned, yes this happens in San Francisco in 50 degree weather, and we had asked the front desk if they had any sun block to spare, she gave us a whole tube to keep!

I highly recommend staying at the W hotel in San Francisco. It was truly amazing, and made our trip that much enjoyable!

review.title: Dissapointed in San Francisco
review.reviewText: After we had checked in and were up in our room we were informed our privacy would be invaded by window cleaners, a remodel of the room next door would be going on from 8 am until 5 pm every day and the pool would be closed a whole day of our four day stay. The room was small and very un-appealing in design.
review.negativeRemarks: Undisclosed construction
review.locationRemarks: Near convention center away from Fisherman's wharf

review.title: Cobell Anniversary
review.reviewText: Great concierge service....DVD/CD player and remotes didn't work and had to be replaced. Champagne I ordered for our arrival wasn't there when we arrived and had to call twice to have it delivered. All in all staff was great and hotel was nice...would surely stay there again!
review.negativeRemarks: the non-surprise I spent time arranging for our arrival
review.locationRemarks: good location pretty central to downtown

review.title: Love Bliss products
review.reviewText: Staff was extremely helpful. REALLY wish they had blackout blinds/curtain in the room. When the sun came up at 5am....we were up. Love the Bliss products in the room.

review.title: Wonderful hotel in downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: The room was clean & the staff very attentive. The staff helped us with navigation around the city. The Acura experience was a nice bonus as well! I would definitely stay at this W Hotel again!
review.positiveRemarks: The clean & well decorated rooms & the helpful staff.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to Union Square, the BART, & Chinatown.

review.title: Rude
review.reviewText:
The room was nicely decorated, but extremely loud 24/7, we must've been on the other side of the wall from the HVAC units.

The front desk staff was hit or miss. Most were nice, but one counter person clearly didn't want to be bothered, only answered in one word answers, and said "buh-bye" when she was done and dust want to give anymore information. She gave us false information and almost cost us a parking ticket

review.title: Would visit again.
review.reviewText: Highly recommended. Great space and comfortable. Great bar. Excellent staff and beds.

review.title: BEST HOTEL EVER
review.reviewText: THE HOTEL WAS THE MOST COZIEST ONE I HAVE EVER HAD THE PLEASURE OF STAYING AT, THE ROOM WAS VERY CLEAN AND ROOMY. THE SERVICE WAS AMAZING AND ANY REQUEST WAS MET QUICKLY. THE LOCATION WAS ALSO PERFECT FOR ALL OUR TOURIST ACTIVITIES. I WOULD TOTALLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE.

review.title: A Weekend San Francisco Getaway
review.reviewText: Everything about the W Hotel was perfect from start to finish. The customer service was spectacular. We got upgraded and were on the 30th floor with a great view of the city. Not that we spent much time looking out the window because we were busy exploring and sightseeing. I loved the window seat, the decor of the room and bathroom, and how comfortable the bed was.
review.positiveRemarks: The customer service and the view from the room.
review.negativeRemarks: The people who decided to party in the hallway late at night.
review.locationRemarks: Great location and convenient to everything we wanted to see.

review.title: Fantastic Honeymoon stay
review.reviewText:
On honeymoon and room upgraded with free breakfast for first morning thrown in as a present! Lovely thought.
Struggling with jetlag at one point and needed a nap, but this was a little difficult due to renovation works going on in the room next door during the day. Got to do it sometimes though and never any noise at night time.
Fantastic staff, very cool bar and great food at breakfast. Good location, 10 mins walk to Union Square and Cable cars etc.

review.title: Amazing Experience
review.reviewText: Everything was great! Customer service is always a MUST for me and the hotel staff at the W understands the importance. My boyfriend and I had the pleasure of meeting the concierge, Florina. She was awesome!!! She helped us plan our entire trip in San Francisco and saved us money. I heart her. I was very pleased with the lounge area as well.

review.title: Incredible service
review.reviewText: WONDERFUL service. Hotel has clearly invested in fantastic staff and it has paid off, although there does seem to be some tradeoff with core services like decor and gym.

review.title: Great Food and Comfort
review.reviewText: Its amazing the quality of their restaurant, you need to take dinner there, every dish and dessert 10 perfect, not cheap but great kitchen... a very good option in general because of the luxury, service, food and area where it is...

review.title: A very happy honeymoon! :)
review.reviewText: My husband & I recently stayed at the W San Fran for our honeymoon. Our stay was incredible, the room was upgraded at no charge & we were sent a special treat by the manager as a newlywed gift, which was super thoughtful. The decor, views and cleanliness along with being modern to our taste, were truly phenomenal. The staff was excellent with tending to any needs we had & the Acura car service (especially our driver Bob) were fantastic! Overall, we enjoyed our whole week & will highly recommend it to others! We can't wait to come back!!!
review.negativeRemarks: The food at Trace was a bit too eclectic for my taste, unfortunately, I was hoping for something a bit more "normal".
review.locationRemarks: We loved San Fran & found the hotel to be perfectly located to dining, shopping, entertainment & site seeing.

review.title: Fantastic place
review.reviewText: Nice trip to stay in W San Francisco! Lounge bar at the lobby is super awesome just like other W hotel worldwide. Food is tasty. Only problem is the air-conditioner in the room.

review.title: BEWARE MY MIDDLE AGED FRIENDS
review.reviewText: If you are between the age of 18 through 32 this is the ideal hotel for you as the lobby of W turns into more of a bar scene after 8pm. Not so good if you are over 45 and enjoy unwinding in the lobby before and after dinner. The hotel is loud and is filled with young adults on the "make.". I was looking forward to romantic and quiet weekend with my husband and unfortunatley this hotel fell short of my expectation. I guess everyone needs a place to hang out so if you are over 40 BEWARE unless you are into that kind of thing. Also, the hotel looks kinda worn but they were remodeling during our stay which could be heard in our room during the day. On the positive side the staff was right on it. They all were awesome and very friendly Service was a 10!
review.negativeRemarks: the lobby was a bar scene
review.locationRemarks: the ocation was central to everything

review.title: Not up to par
review.reviewText:
Atmosphere: Typical W hotel. Which means, the entire first floor lobby is essentially one large club/bar. Good if you like that atmosphere. However, also means that it's very loud and noisy, and that you can't meet anybody there for a quiet conversation or for a family dinner. The actual reception / concierge area is also very small, and can get crowded at times.

Location: Good: right next to SF MOMA and Moscone convention center Bad: right next to a fire station. Be prepared for sirens at any time during the day and night.

Room: compared with club-like decor (dark with neon lights) of lobby and the corridor, surprisingly plain. Beds are comfortable, but room is smallish. And what is with the transparent door to the bathroom (right across the toilet)??

Amenities: the gym is a joke. Just a few treadmills and a set of dumbbells. The pool is very small. Also, the power in the room went out suddenly, and half of the TV channels did not work most of the time. I've read similar complains from others --- seems to me that they have some endemic problem with their electronic system.

Staff: friendly, but not quite helpful. Actually knew that TV didn't work, but didn't bother to tell me. Took a while to get the power problem fixed even after I called them.

Verdict: Unless you really like the atmosphere of W hotel, there are other hotels nearby that offer better, at lower prices.

review.title: Disaster at the W
review.reviewText: Reminded me of a "college spring break" hotel in Mazatlan. Dirty, terrible service and strange clientele. Nothing like the W in Scottsdale. I stayed one night and checked out.
review.negativeRemarks: People partying in the hall until 2-3am

review.title: W rocks
review.reviewText: Typical W, and that's a good thing. Nice lobby bar, especially hopping on weekends. Rooms nice and spacious with very helpful staff. Would stay again.

review.title: the best hotel
review.reviewText: this is a nice hotel, very modern and stylish, very good location. i would recommend everyone to stay in this hotel, the lobby and bars were always full of young people, and the restaurant was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: best experience

review.title: W Hotel Great
review.reviewText: Great stay. young hip. Wouldn't have my parents stay here, nor my kids.

review.title: Upbeat
review.reviewText: Brilliant hotel, definately good for people loking for a lively upbeat atmosphere.
review.negativeRemarks: out of date chocolate in snack case
review.locationRemarks: wonderful

review.title: W Hotel
review.reviewText: I was very surprised when I arrived on Sunday 1/15/12 that we had no room. I had booked through Expedia and payed in advance for 3 rooms. I was unable to arrive in one of the rooms on Saturday 1/14/12. I did arrive very early 8:30 A.M. on 1/15/12 and asked for a room. I was told then there was none available. I asked how this was possible, since we paid in advance. I was told that because no one checked in on Saturday they resold the room. I then spoke with a manager and explained the situation. He tried his best and did come up with a room after about 1 hour. My understanding is that a room paid in advance is always available especially paying for them in advance. Please correct me if this is not the case.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: feel like a rock star before you even enter
review.reviewText:
Modern, but not cold. The staff are there for your every need. I ordered room service three nights in a row....consistently delicious, and timely. Having a hotel car to take you to a close by destination is great...they are paying attention to the details.

Side bar: one un-done detail that was a shame was the beautiful artisnal quilt on the bed had a large tear in it, that looked like it was from wear...laundry etc.

also, there was a note on the desk from the last guest...nothing that meant anything to me, just housekeeping again, should have noticed.
review.positiveRemarks: A hip vibe as soon as you enter the hotel...it just takes you away. The rooms are modern but with warmth...very comfortable beds!
review.negativeRemarks: A little chilly in the lobby...more heating would be helpful
review.locationRemarks: Perfect if you're going to the Fancy Food Show. Everyone stays there!

review.title: I'd return for a longer stay!
review.reviewText: I flew in from LA and arrived to the hotel at 11 am. I figured they would take my bag and tell me to return in 4 hours for check in. Instead, they let me check in right then! We were on 6th floor and it was quiet! Had room service breakfast- expensive (of course) but good. I'd go back!

review.title: Very good SF urban hotel experience
review.reviewText: Nicely urban and trendy-feeling hotel. A comfortable and pleasant stay. Only negative was that the thermostat would not go lower than 65 degress which made for a too-warm sleeping experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was too warm
review.locationRemarks: Perfect SOMA location, down the street from SFMOMA.

review.title: Left a lot to be desired
review.reviewText: Room service never came to clean the room. We had to call down at about 3-4PM to request housekeeping clean the room. The room and bathroom was very small. No counterspace in the bathroom. The shower was a tub with a shower curtain. Was expecting something more modern with at least a glass door for the shower. Just expected more luxious accommodations.

review.title: W- SF
review.reviewText: Disappointed with the quality of my 16th fl corner room. Air conditioning was lacking consistent cool air, sink slow to drain and HD channels on TV were unable to be watched due to constant break-up.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Prime spot within the Financial District to reach every part of downtown.
review.negativeRemarks: No informal restaurant.

review.title: W Hotel San Francisco cost review
review.reviewText:
I had only a few options for my stay at San Francisco this last week (due to a late booking) and the W San Francisco Hotel was one of them. It was directly accross from the Moscone Center South where my meetings where held so I chose to stay at that hotel.
The cost was extremely high for what I received as benefit of my dollars.
I stayed at the Palomar hotel the year before at more than half the cost and received a much higher per dollar benefit than I did at the W.
Really, if I'm paying in the multi-hundreds of dollars per day then I truly expect that I shouldn't have to PAY for internet - this is rediculous as well as the cost of room service. I ordered a turkey club and paid over $30 for the sandwich.
I will admit that it was a very tasty meal with a lot of food but nevertheless the cost is much higher than justified for what you are recieving.
Finally the staff was abrupt with me in the few times that I needed to get help - specifically when I was asking for help over the telephone.
The personal interaction with cleaning staff was very good and the interaction during check-in was good but the interaction over the phone was rude.

Overall the cost of the W Hotel San Francisco is TOO HIGH where you are paying for nothing additional but just the name "W".
I do not recommend this hotel at all.

Sincerely yours

review.title: Rough Start
review.reviewText: I was really excited for a well needed girls night out. My inital interaction with the staff was less than pleasant. I was checking into my room and the woman was very confused by the notes in the computer. She said that the payment was never received by expedia and it took her several trips to the back room to speak to the manager to realize this was not the case. I also lost my license and debit card the day before my visit and called the front desk to make the necessary arrangments. I was assured there would not be a problem upon check in. This was not the case. I explained what happened to a very snotty manager who could not care less to help. It look about a half hour to finally resolve the situation. The rest of the stay was fine after the bumpy start. Would not stay there again.

review.title: outstanding customer service & great location
review.reviewText: Service was exceptional, dined in one evening & food was really excellent (as were server's recommendations). Acura drop-off was very convenient. Room was immaculate, location ideal, and high-thread count bedding. Only thing it was missing were slippers for pool/spa.

review.title: Very Hip Hotel.
review.reviewText: Enjoyable experience.

review.title: cant wait to go back
review.reviewText: This was a nice hotel I love the "whenever and what ever line" but the hall way had food in there for like 2 nights and I had to call to have it picked up other then that the stay was great

review.title: deceptioned
review.reviewText:
I stayed for 3 nights at this hotel.
I found in really bad taste that everything (absolutely everything) besides overnight had a high exta cost, even internet and printing at business center (14 dollars to print a 12 pages b&w presentation, ridiculous! + 7 usd for 15min internet use!)
The hotel lobby was being revamped (nobody told it was gonna be, otherwise I would have opted for another hotel). Everytime you needed to contact lobby/concierge personal, there were huge waiting lines.
Rooms were small, and, in contrast to other W Hotels which are gorgeous (i.e. Mexico City / San Diego), this was poorly decorated, it had only a cheap buddha figure and the rest was no different than a hyatt.
Location is not bad, although it is next door to "gentleman club", so its kinda uncomfortable when you walk-by with your girlfriend.
I consider that there are many other, much better options for the same price in the same area such as St Regis (not considering all extras that increase in 50% the rate at W hotel).

review.title: Convenient location but noisy
review.reviewText: Next to the fire station and lots of parties at night.

review.title: My favorite San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText:
The room was large enough for our family of three adults to coexist peacefully in.
The view was gorgeous and the vibe of the room was very light and airy and a place we wanted to hang out in. We especially loved the window seat for two.
The furnishings were beautiful and the bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in.

review.title: jorge
review.reviewText: Hotel lobby was being remodeled, so entrance was temporary. Aside from that the Hotel was exceptional. Service was escellent, friendly staff and a great location. A couple of blocks from Union Square and access to many restaurants walking distance

review.title: In love with San Francisco and in W hotel!
review.reviewText: It was perfect in every way! the young employees at the front desk as the sign says, they will help you with everything anytime with every possible way. The little things in every corner of the room makes you feel home and very welcomed to stay. I stayed for a week with my 3 members of my family and we had one of our best stays.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: The W Hotel offers an excellent hotel with well appointed rooms, excellent staff and superior service. Will be back soon.

review.title: great!!!
review.reviewText: had a good time with my son

review.title: Elegant
review.reviewText: Nice views. Comfortable bedding.

review.title: Food was Delicious!!!!! Greatest Hotel Restaurant Ever!
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the WHOLE HOTEL....from Club to Restaurant to Bar!

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: No coffee maker in room. Coffee available in lobby but had to wait on several occasions. Otherwise hotel was very nice. Pleasant staff and room was clean and interesting. Next to the most busy firestation in the country, so sirens were anoying.

review.title: san fran/napa is probably our best vaca ever...
review.reviewText: awesome hotel....very cool, hip place....the hotties at the concierge desk made our trip amazing....they were so accomadating and helpful.....we didn't need to plan or worry about anything....we just went to them for everything and they took care of it...........and great location too........food and shopping everywhere was 5 star.......Alcatraz was very cool to go see.....napa/sonoma is a must.....the markets down in the ferry building was also a great way to spend a rainy afternoon....

review.title: Wonderful stay at the W
review.reviewText: Having never stayed at a W hotel before, I was pleasantly surprised. From the avant garde deco, to the light up baby buddhas in the room, to the bliss SPA and products in the rooms, I had a glorious time. Located right in the middle of town with great shopping one block away, the hotel is right next door to the SF Museum of Modern Art.

review.title: Fun, clean, comfortable
review.reviewText: Stayed for a night to celebrate my 2nd anniversary with my gf. Service was great, view was great. Anything you might need (we forgot a razor) they'll just bring you. It was very clean and the look of the room (Fabulous Corner room) was very nice. A draft beer at the bar was $8 though... I mean, it's not that much, but anywhere else in the city a beer is $5 or less. Hotels are lame like that I suppose.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel in the middle of downtown San Francisco. It is close enough to walk to pretty much everything. The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very comfortable. The pool and spa were nice and the exercise room was good also.

review.title: The only hotel for me
review.reviewText: If you are visiting San Francisco, I can't think of a better place to stay than the W. It was perfect in every way. And the room service was delicious, one of the best burgers I've ever had!

review.title: Business Center Problems
review.reviewText:
Despite its hipster/high-tech reputation, the W San Francisco had a business center without a single working printer when we were there...hardly a functional business center. Nor did they seem terribly motivated to deal with the problem in a timely fashion.

Other than the extreme stress this caused (a major potential screwup in a HUGE business deal--though the front desk did come to the rescue at the last minute), the hotel was fine. The room was very comfortable, though the lobby and bar scene are hardly perfection for us 50-somethings.

review.title: Modrn is not comfortable
review.reviewText: I know, certainly, W hotels are modern, But I do not understand the small bed alon with Window. What's more, Front and bar is very crowded. For Japaese, I am not satisfied with such a mess

review.title: Great Trendy Downtown SanFran location!
review.reviewText: W Hotel was a great place to stay with out 17yr old twin boys. They have a DJ in the lobby fri/sat nites.. so we cd sit & listen to music as a family. Great walk to AT&T park... easy to catch SF Giants game. Quick walk to all public transportation, staff was very helpful about events/directions. We would definitely stay again!

review.title: A+ for the W
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, comfortable, elegant room, incredible service, great food, ideal location. Looking forward to staying here again.

review.title: Wonderful at the W San Fran
review.reviewText: First off, please know that our experience at the W was tremendous. Yes, does the hotel lobby need a refresh, but from the letter that was left in our room, they are starting that. The service was 5 star the entire time, especially at the "Whatever, Whenever" desk, and the Acura service is amazing. Great room, very clean and luxurious. Overall fantastic stay!

review.title: Disaster at the W
review.reviewText: Pictures were really misleading on the internet. Rooms are very small and there is no drawer space. Plan to live out of your suitcase. The pool and gym looked huge in the pictures. Very small would be an under-statement. With poor management skills, I would strongly recommend the Hilton or Hyatt for a similar cost.

review.title: Not the best, better than most
review.reviewText: This was my fifth stay at the W. While this hotel chain once stood for (a least for me) higher-end quality with a youthful, hip, urban flair, this particular location never quite hits the mark. Service mishaps included room service that showed up with half my order, then returned 10 minutes later with my full order (which means I accidentally ate someone's burger. Mini-bar wine was dreadful, the bliss spa is an automated wreck and the concierge knows less about the area than I do. Lobby scene at night is a bit of a drag and the whole place felt a little past it's prime. I can't see myself coming back here again. I like hotels to be a delightful, restful escape. While the W delvers a certain amount of style, it never seems to cross over into truly exceptional service or presentation. It says a lot that the hotel restaurant food is worse than room service. I would say stay here if you must, but expect pleasant mediocrity.

review.title: High Price for what you get
review.reviewText: Great look. Room a little small but nice appointments. GREAT bed! Very comfortable. Loud areas around hallway and room. Too expensive in comparison to other similarly located hotels.

review.title: Great experience in S.F.
review.reviewText: The W was an excellent place to stay. I was in town for three days for a training seminar. The hotel was centrally located and the service was great. They had a nice workout room as well.

review.title: 3 nights at the W
review.reviewText:
After viewing the hotel online, I had some concern it may be too trendy for my comfort level. But, instead, it turned out to be a good choice. Although I only reserved a basic room, on check-in I was upgraded to a much higher floor with an awesome view. The room was a little unconventional with some cutesy features, but over a 3-day stay I found it very comfortable and an inviting place to return after either a full day of work or exploration of the city. I enoyed the location which I found much less hectic than Union Square with a variety of nearby reastaurants and coffee shops. In particular, it is across from a wonderful microbrewery with an impressive tapas menu.

I met friends who stayed near Union Square in what was billed as a boutique hotel near Union Square, and I much preferred the quiet and modernity of the W.

review.title: No worries when staying at the W Hotel
review.reviewText: From the time we drove in, everything was handled by staff supremely! We checked in early with no troubles, got a fantastic corner suite with a great view, walked to Union Square, the "cafe" is a happening place at night....... They even drove us to the symphony that night! Cant wait to have another amazing weekend in SF and stay at the W!

review.title: outstanding
review.reviewText: About as good as it gets in SF. Young crowd, but all are welcome.

review.title: Premium Hotel that nickel and dime for everything
review.reviewText: Premium Hotel that nickel and dime for everything... including $8 fee for printing a boading pass!

review.title: W San Fran
review.reviewText: For being at the W the fire station might as well be in the building you could hear it every 5 minutes. The alarm was never reset in the room so it went off the first 2 nights at 2am before I realized what the hell it was. The restaurant was great downstairs access to the convention couldn't be better. Would I stay at this W again, I dont think so. Asked for a view and didn't get much of one.

review.title: Won't get back
review.reviewText: I do recognize that it's a very elegant, modern and trendy hotel. But the rooms, at least mine, was way too SMALL, I felt claustrophobic there and couldn't wait to get ready in the morning to get out! There is no privacy at all when your in the bathroom, the door is a sliding glass door which makes a hugh sound when it's open that is impossible to go at night and not wake up your company. To top it all, the room services is expansive, and I mean really expensive. I order a plate of fruit, chilaquiles, coffee, one orange juice and a glass of milk, and the check was for 70 DOLLARDS. The same day I went to a very nice restaurant at the city and pay the same amount for an entire meal for two.

review.title: I like W
review.reviewText:
W has the best ambient atmosphere, greatest inhabitants and the best equipped rooms. It's classy, smells funny (that smell makes you want to come back), it's elevators have stereo images embedded so you want to ride all the time. XYZ and bar are awesome, WHATEVER WHENEVER service is flawless.

PS Don't stay on the top floor if you don't want to be annoyed by elevators.

review.title: Cool place to stay!
review.reviewText: DJ in lobby. Nice hotel pool. rooms are clean and spacious.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was cool staff nice but busy. bar was a little too trendy with too cool people there. but room and spa were very nice.

review.title: Will be going back 4 sure!
review.reviewText: Loved the atmosphere...Price was about average for a Frisco hotel and its in walking distance to AT&T park. Loved the rooms and especially the bed. Can't wait to go back.

review.title: Small but great room
review.reviewText: Modern, nice location, great hospitality and good martinis.

review.title: okay...
review.reviewText: The room was fun and funky but really small - my friends said it felt like someone's bedroom... the room price wasn't too bad for a nice hotel in sf but parking is $50!!! I live in sf and had planned on taking the bus but was running late... My friend brought a birthday cake for me which we were unable to refrigerate because the mini bar was packed. We called room service to get plates for our cake - they said it would be $4 per plate which we thought was ridiculous! We went to bliss spa and i had a 75 minute blissage massage which was okay. I tried using the sauna which didn't seem to be working. My steam shower was very nice, but my friend used a different steam shower after her treatment and it never steamed. For a place that has a lobby full of lotions and potions to purchase i was very surprised at the bare bones locker room. I was hoping for at least a sample or 2 of lotion... I get more samples from Sephora!!! After spending $150 + $20 tip for a bare bones spa experience, i was disappointed and will not go back to the spa. As for the hotel, I would recommend it to out of towners for the great location and fun and funky vibe. As a local, I will not stay there again.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: We had a great stay at the W San Francisco. It was a short trip anywhere we wanted to go and the hotel staff was very helpful.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was extremely hospitable and was of great assistance. They did everything possible to accommodate to our needs. The hotel is conveniently located so everywhere we wanted to go was in walking distance. We were also able to use the complementary car service at the W, which was wonderful and it was very easy to make reservations. Additionally, the amenities were great! We definitely recommend the W and can't wait to come back!

review.title: Great hotel for the younger crowd
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed at the W for the weekend while visiting San Francisco for the first time. Since this was our first time visiting we wanted to go see some sights and were happy to find out that there was a complimentary car service to take us to any destination. All the major landmarks are only a few miles away from the hotel. The room was chic and clean and the bed was comfy. If you do not wish to go out at night, the lobby turns into a lounge. On saturday night there was a dj in the lobby spinning music and people congregated at the bar. The only downside is that it is very hard to find parking in San Francisco in general.

review.title: SFO's W Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel and restuarant were nice. the service was excellent. The room was clean and modern but a little on the small side

review.title: Is a nice hotel
review.reviewText: great location close to many activities.

review.title: Cool digs
review.reviewText: Very modern, chic hotel in the heart of SoMa. Room was very comfortable for our family of three (one teenager). Would have liked a little more drawer space for clothes. My 14-year-old daughter loved the very hip scene in the lobby. Probably not the best place for families with small children.

review.title: W Hotel San Francisco
review.reviewText: I had some concerns about the W given that there are some negative reviews online, but I was very pleased. Everything was great, and the room was very cool. A little more modern than your typical run-of-the-mill hotel room.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Good Stay

review.title: definitively a place to recommend
review.reviewText: very well located - service + accomodation + and quiet...

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: While not as nice as the W in Scottsdale, AZ the W in SFO is a great place. It tends to get crowded by the concierge desk so you may have to wait. And, being SFO, the sidewalk outside attracts the usual collection of crazy homeless people. I would stay here again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The W was a fantastic "base camp" for our weekend adventure. We came to SFO to run in the Bay to Breakers race, and chose the W as the start line was nearby. Thankfully, EVERYTHING seemed to be nearby - great restaurants, coffee, entertainment. The coolest part was use of "the Acura". Just go to the concierge/Acura desk, tell them where you'd like to go, and there is an Acura on the curb, complete with driver, ready to take you to your destination!

review.title: Clean convenient
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Good location.

review.title: BE PREPARED TO PAY FOR PARKING
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and clean but the room was pretty small. If you like this trendy, modern type of place you will like it but I will never recommend this hotel because of the price of parking which was more than $50 a night.

review.title: Concierge is excellent
review.reviewText: We had such a great stay. The room was clean and beautiful. I wish the sheets were a little softer but it was still a great stay. The bathroom was spotless and room service was excellent. The best part was the concierge. They were so helpful, nice, funny and interesting. We sent them on several missions and they performed stellar! The W's motto is "What is your Wish?" and we had several wishes and all were granted. I would absolutely stay again.

review.title: top notch
review.reviewText: Everything is perfect (or Wonderful, as they prefer) from the moment you walked in. Upscale and trendy - it's probably the hippest hotel around. Always a scene at the bar. Great rooms. Great view. Great service. We lucked out too as they had the 'Acura Experience' which was basically just free rides to anywhere in the city in a Acura MDX. Wonderful.

review.title: Very nice hotel!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff was very helpful and very friendly. Our room was small, but clean. We would recommend this hotel to everyone!

review.title: Great view, not quality I expected...
review.reviewText: Once you have stayed at the Lakeshoe W in Chicago, this was a bit disappointing. The restaurant was & lounge were the best part of this hotel. Pretty fireplace & comfy couches. Great drink selection & delicious food. The room theme was buddah/ Zen room pink green & white with a buddah lamp...a little strange for my tastes. I did like the beautiful corner view of the Bay. The bathroom has a door that is somewhat opaque glass...but what is the point of a door when you can see the person showering through the glass? Also the kids grilled cheese sandwich was $14 without gratuity... a little excessive for bread & cheese. It did have a great location and that is what you are really paying for.

review.title: W Hotel San Francisco
review.reviewText: The W I entered was not at all as I had imagined it, but I was, nonetheless, impressed. Having been to the Boston W, I expected W San Francisco to be similarly decorated. While not necessarily cheap, our Asian-inspired room was slightly less impressive than the contemporary quite I visited in Boston. Ups: fitness center was more than adaquate, the leisure pool was skylit, and there were free yoga sessions, though I did not take advantage. The room had a good view as well. Downs: a doorman greeted us on our initial arrival, and then was mysteriously absent for the rest of our stay, not even available to open cab doors for the night out, something I would expect from a hotel of this caliber. The bathroom door handle was also in disrepair. Overall I was throughly impressed though they could invest in a greeter who works weekends.

review.title: W knows how to make you feel like and King or Queen, one of the best hotel I've stayed in Worldwide.
review.reviewText: Love this hotel, the best. W Hotels knows how far a nice smile, great service and outstanding pampering can go for any type of customer. All of the front desk agents and the Hotel host remember you name after you check in and encounter them once.

review.title: Great hotel, but....
review.reviewText: We stay on valentine weekend this year. She been wanting to stay at this hotel since we first met two years ago. We enjoyed every part of our weekend here. It is a very nice hotel, with great people. The only thing that I had a problem with was the fee for parking. But because of in and out privileges, It didn't bother me anymore. One bad note is that we got a room next to the elevator. The elevator was very loud and annoying when we were trying to get some rest. They tried to change the rooms for us but they said they were completely booked. If we had a quieter room, then i would have given the hotel 5's across the board

review.title: Great experience all around.
review.reviewText: Took the wife here for Valentines day and was very impressed. We had previously stayed at the W Seattle and didn't walk away thinking the hotel was all that great. So we took a chance on the W San Francisco and such a contrasting experience. The service was fantastic, from the front desk to the restaurant, to the spa. The spa is a nice feature in the hotel so that you can just go back up to your room and relax afterwards - recommend. XYZ Restaurant was nice. We only ordered appetizers, dessert, and drinks. But all were good. We also had reservations which was a very good idea. Service was prompt and friendly. Even from the hostess who took pictures for multiple couples that night. Definitely recommend the plate of cookies and milk for dessert. Indoor pool is a nice feature. Although when we went to use it, someone had broken glass in the pool so it was closed. Not the hotel's fault, but a bummer none the less. Room was very clean. Good size for two. The interior design was done quite well. Which is what this hotel is mostly known for. Overall, very happy with the stay and would like to try other W Hotels now. Just not the Seattle one again.

review.title: small comfortable hip
review.reviewText: the room is small but it's cute, clean and modern. i stayed in the "spectacular" room and it was pretty pricey but i decided to splurge for my business trip this time around. It's definitely a high quality hotel, pricey and a nice restaurant. Right next door is the modern are museum. It was a bit smaller than i had hoped it to be but comfortable enough for one person.

review.title: near shopping zone
review.reviewText: very close to all the shopping area (Union Square), and with a 25 minute walk your at the Pier 1.

review.title: Very honest and relaxing hotel
review.reviewText: W Hotel is great experience overall. It is relaxing, has very nice young atmosphere has very good location in Financial District

review.title: A must for anyone traveling to San Francisco!
review.reviewText: Beautiful Hotel...A bit pricey, but worth every penny!

review.title: small rooms
review.reviewText: rooms are very small though for the price they charge per night. They provide bikes for free, on a first come first served basis.

review.title: A good stay despite initial problems
review.reviewText: Overall, our experience at the W was a good one. The room was fun and comfortable and the staff tried to be very helpful and responsive to our needs. The vibe of the downstairs bar area was very good. The only problem we had was that our first room was a smoking room. When I called down to get a new room, the staff person told me the entire hotel was non-smoking, but it was obviously a smoking room with smoke residue on everything. After I insisted on a new room, they found us another. The bellhop then told us the hotel had recently converted to a non-smoking hotel. Basically, the hotel changed the designation of the room to non-smoking without actually physically changing anything about it. It smelled bad. No way we could stay there. It turned out okay. My wife and I had a great weekend.

review.title: Great hotel in SF!
review.reviewText: Having always had bad experiences with high end hotels, I decided to give it one last go for the Thanksgiving holiday. From the moment we walked through the door at the W, we were greeted and asked if there was anything we needed before we checked in. The hotel staff were consistently helpful and friendly. I was sort of floored by it. The hotel and rooms are decorated with a more modern flair, but if that isn't your thing you might want to stay somewhere else. The XYZ restaurant was delicious and moderately priced. Beds were super comfortable and amazing views all around. Didn't get a chance to visit the pool, but walked into the work out room. Top of the line equipment in there. This hotel renewed my faith in higher end hotels. One drawback was the trendy hipster crowd at the bar. There was a fight that broke out one Saturday evening, but that happens in most bars I've been to.

review.title: Good service
review.reviewText: I like the hotel, the only issue might be that the bar is in the main lobby and a lot of people is drinking where you take the lifts, or if you're arriving with your stuff you can go straight you have to skip all the people. THANKS

review.title: very happy
review.reviewText: the whole staff was great great selections by the employees on what attractions to go see and places to dine out and the bar servers and waitress were great

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: It was my birthday and they brought up a surprise tray of strawberries. Thanks again!

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: I had a great stay at this hotel from the moment I checked in. Check-in was very friendly and took less then 2 minutes and as a bonus the room was ready when I arrived (3 hours earlier then normal check-in time). Everything is really fun and well appointed, I even had a cool Buddha statue that glowed pink, purple and blue! The freebies (shampoo, conditioner, body wash, etc.) are all Bliss products... so for the first time I used the hotels and not my own. I stayed here because of its proximity to the Moscone center and would highly recommend it to anyone in town for a trade show or local area business.

review.title: San Francisco Trip
review.reviewText: Parking was $45 plus tax. if you are paying top doller for the room I think they can cover the parking fee.

review.title: Too many Service errors!
review.reviewText: I just stayed for three nights and was initially impressed with the smart appearance of the hotel and the small but cutely appointed room. The valet lost our laundry and we were charged more than $280 for a phone call overseas when it should have been $130. It took a lot of time to get the matter rectified and we didnt get our laundry back. The cost of the call was fully reimbursed but the feeling I got from the staff not one of apology but that we had done something wrong. I lost my confidence in W.

review.title: Not a typical W
review.reviewText: Not a tipical w hotel. Except being beautifuly decorated, i was disapointed with the overall service. Internet excess was way too expensive. Most of the 5 stars hotels do not charge you $15 a day for the internet connection. The rooms were way too small. When we ordred breakfast, that we paid $80 for, we did not even had a space to put the delivery cart at. My husband and i love to stay in luxurious hotels, W San francisco is definetely NOT the one.

review.title: W San Francisco - Wonderful but...
review.reviewText: I stayed at the W San Francisco for two nights and I really enjoyed my stay overall. The room was very clean, the beds were so comfortable, everything in the room was perfect. Everything about the W is very upscale, very high-class yet hip and trendy. My two complaints are the following: 1. To use the computers in the business center, you have to pay $6.95 per 15 minutes. Many other expensive hotels I've stayed at provide not only free computer access in the business center but also free printing and faxing. I wanted to look up a few things, being unfamiliar with San Francisco, but I could only look up so much for 15 minutes. I get that the hotel charges for in-room internet usage. That is pretty standard, but to charge for computer usage in the business center and at such a high price...that was frustrating and disappointing. It makes a guest feel as though the hotel is trying to squeeze every dollar it can out of you. 2. No gift shop. I know that not everyone likes souvenirs but I'm not asking for tacky things. Maybe some nice zip-up hoodies with "W San Francisco" in small embroidery on the left corner. Also, it would be nice to have a gift shop in the lobby for any incidentals you forgot or need, i.e. cold medicine, a soda, a magazine, etc. Other than those two complaints, I would highly recommend the W.

review.title: Very modern and cool San Francisco hotel
review.reviewText: The W hotel was the final stop for us on a tour of San Francisco and the wine country. After staying in a grand and more old fashioned hotel the previous week, the W was a big change. The hotel is super sleek and very crisp looking with lots of quirky touches. The TV that can be covered with a mirror is particularly nice... There's nothing that can be faulted although the only criticism would be that it felt a little soul less although that's probably to be expected in a big city, chain hotel. Overall highly recommended.

review.title: Sleek and Techo-hip and Very Good
review.reviewText: As with other W hotels I have stayed, the W in San Francisco is highly stylized with modern and contemporary furnishings and art but with enough funky artifacts smartly placed to take away any perception of cold and impersonal space. The accent is on youth at the W chain, but I am in my early 60's and like the hotel not only for its style but most especially for its attentive and professional staff. Excellent concierge service. Fine location.

review.title: Close to just about all you want to do in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very trendy hotel...nightlife here is great and food is excellent...every "W" hotel I have stayed at has had the most comfortable beds especially the pillows!

review.title: A perfect stay for a price
review.reviewText: Although on the expensive side the W is a great hotel. It is in a great location next to the museum of modern art and the view from our room on the 28th floor was wonderful. The staff were excellent at advising us on everything we asked and were very helpful with late checkout requests. I would certainly stay here again. The only minus is the ground floor bar on some nights was full of rather pretentious idiots but there are plenty of other places to drink around this great city!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel in a great spot. Close enough to most things if you have nice walking shoes. Parking is expensive but rooms and restaurant were great.

review.title: Great, fun, hip Hotel
review.reviewText: We loved the W - the fun, quirky rooms and hotel decor are a real departure from the norm! Location is also great - within walking distance to the Waterfront, Union Square and China Town. The rooms are not the most quiet we have experienced and the bar is very busy at the w-ends, so not the best choice for someone looking for complete rest and relaxation.

review.title: Great Beds Not so Great Service
review.reviewText: great view if you are facing 3rd street if you are facing the valet area you might only see ugly decrepit industrial buildings. beds are ultra comfortable, wonderful room decor stinks of cheap stuff found at a 99cent store. buddha lamp, can I say more. tacky and cheap, why do the lock the treats and drinks in the individual rooms. overpriced parking, staff is very reluctant to budge.

review.title: less than expect
review.reviewText: nice view, small room, good customer service, bad menue( not enough options!) the bed did not live up to it's reputation, not very comfortable

review.title: So nice you don't want to leave the room
review.reviewText: I often stay at The W Hotel, and love it everytime. The hotel really focuses on the details!

review.title: Really cool place to stay, very convenient
review.reviewText: Nice little details, like the button on the phone which says 'Whatever'

review.title: Newly Decorated
review.reviewText: Rooms have been redecorated and are bright and clean

review.title: Superb
review.reviewText: One of the nicest W Hotels I have stayed in. Can't wait to go back. Spectacular views of the Bay Bridge and downtown San Francisco.

review.title: W SFO
review.reviewText: Great location. Our room has great view of the bay bridge at night. The room service was very good and the bar downstairs is always happening with a great crowd. The price was within range for SFO and the luxury of the hotel. A must go!

review.title: Pleasantly Surprised by this Hotel
review.reviewText: Frankly I had always avoided this hotel since I felt it was a bit too "hip" for me. (I booked it due to the deal pricing.) However, I was pleasantly surprised and very happy with my stay here. The staff was fantastic, everyone, from the front desk to the bellman to the room service people to the bartender. The room was small, but very nice. Fantastically comfortable bed. They upgraded me to a "Fabulous" room with a great view of the Yerba Buena Area. Mini bar & room service prices are about the same as everybody else's, kind of high but you pay for the convienence. The room service food was way above average. Real Nice, but small, bathrooms. I will stay here again.

review.title: Too crowded with non guests
review.reviewText: I was looking forward to the luxury of the W, however I could not enjoy the hotel outside of my room. The bar was packed with people not staying there. A hoard of young people without the room keys necessary for elevator access tried to scam rides upstairs, leaving us feeling very uneasy and unsafe. There was no security. I was looking forward to a relaxing drink and music in the lounge, but was unable to find a seat and the bar was 5 deep. Not a place to enjoy and relax

review.title: Excellent Stay
review.reviewText: Overall, very pleased with the SF W experience. Best part is the location - the hotel is walking distance to so many great sites, restaurants and stores.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: you're nickled and dimed for everything. no free internet, no coffee maker in the room. not even a free bottle of water. different charges for internet use in the room, business center etc. overnight parking charge astronomical.

review.title: Always great
review.reviewText: Everytime I have been to the W hotel they it has been exceptional. I even needed a iPhone charger and they had one. I was very impressed. Great Bar and restaurant too.

review.title: Great Facility Service and Location
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed staying at the W san francisco. Nice that the pool and hot tub are open 24 hours. Great location close to San francisco museum of modern art and close to union square. Well appointed rooms and excellent service.

review.title: Overall Very Pleased
review.reviewText: I thought the rooms were a bit small.. But I was so impressed by the service I received I ended up loving this hotel... It very Slick and high end...

review.title: Fun & Hip
review.reviewText: Everyone at the hotel was friendly and fun! We are already planning our next trip back and staying at the W hotel again.

review.title: Fab Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel, fab rooms and even better that it has a gym and pool. Our 7 year old daughter thought it was fantastic and they made her feel very welcome.

review.title: First time at a W -- and it was awesome!
review.reviewText: The location was great; the restaurant (XYZ) was outstanding; the funky room with all its colors and cool little extras (Chinese checkers board, lots of data access plugs, great shower, terrific desk, comfy bed, terrific wide-screen TV, great view of Bay Bridge) was fun and more than comfortable. The staff in the lobby (check-in, concierge, bar personnel) was VERY friendly and helpful. A great (although too brief) stay!! Go there!!

review.title: Luxury, modern & chic
review.reviewText: Excelent hotel for the "avant guard" people. Modern, cozy, exhuberant. A nice lobby bar. The rooms are in excelent conditions and is a good place for the bussiness people.

review.title: Trendy Hotel with Aloof Staff
review.reviewText: The W was very trendy and after 4:00 pm, the lounge area was packed with business-types. The room was small, but very comfortable and the view of the bay was beautiful. Also, the location of the hotel is in close proximity to many attractions. My only complaint would be that the staff seemed aloof. We arrived early and the staff said they would find us in the lounge when the room was ready. After 45 minutes, my wife went to the desk and the same staff said the room was ready but he couldn't find us despite the 2 of us being seated within visual distance of the desk and being the only people in the lounge with suitcases. Continuing, another guest was given our room as well and was able to open the door with his key as I was preparing to take a shower. Finally, they charged us for using the convenience bar when we didn't access any of the items. A couple who checked out immediately after us complained of the same mistake happening to them. To conclude, the stay was very pleasant, but don't rely too heavily on the staff.

review.title: W is a Winner!
review.reviewText: The front desk upgraded us up a room class, and we looooved it. Had a refreshing dip in their pool, and otherwise enjoyed the tasteful facilities. Only disappointment was having to pay for internet access ... far less impressive hotels offer free wireless/internet access.

review.title: Going back ASAP! OOOOh, Bliss!
review.reviewText: Love the doggie menu as well as the amentities for the little poochies. They make life easy for spoiled dogs!

review.title: Lively Hotel - Central location
review.reviewText: Came from Edinburgh for a weeks business trip - good to stay 'downtown' for the weekend. Second time in W - rooms are cosy and comfortable, enjoyed the loation and the mixed set that stay here. Good place for drinks before hitting the town. Would recomend

review.title: Simply Wonderful
review.reviewText: Amazing. Really modern and funky. They have thought about everything. Everyone should definitely try the cocktails in the hotel bar XYZ. It's a perfect location, right next to the MOMA and near to Union Square. You'd be crazy not to stay here!

review.title: Don't stay here unless your rich.....
review.reviewText: This was the worst hotel experiance i've ever had. Sure the hotel looked nice, but the service was horrable. They didn't have any parking so we asked the valet where we could park our cars. Well when we parked where he told us to, we went to our room, anyway after we woke up in the morning i needed to go out to my car to get something, when i got down to the parking spot, i was shocked to discover that my car had been towed, along with my friends. So after having an argument with the front desk, i finally had to go and get my car out of impound, Which the hotel never even offerd to pay for, it costed me and my friends 200 bucks a piece. i wouldn't suggest this hotel to anyone...it was a nightmare!!!!

review.title: San Fran's best hotel!
review.reviewText: This was a wonderful hotel located right in the heart of the city. The staff is very friendly and the concierges are wonderful. We had a view of Twin Peaks from our hotel room, it was great. We were located next door to the MOMA of San Francisco and a few blocks away from Bloomingdales shopping center.

review.title: Just Perfect
review.reviewText: One of the best hotels I have ever been. From the bellmen to the XYZ restaurant, which is located at the lobby of the hotel, all "excelent". Locked yourself outside the room?! In less than 2 minutes security was there to open the door. Leaving the room in the morning just to take breakfast downstairs and coming back, finding the room completely CLEAN and all set in order, this is priceless.

review.title: Cant wait to go back
review.reviewText: Really nice Lounge area

review.title: Will Definitely Come Back Again
review.reviewText: A little pricey but worth the price, since it's fairly close to so many things...Staff was most curteous and my room was very comfortable.

review.title: modern, clean, good location
review.reviewText: W was an excellent hotel over a recent business trip weekend. the rooms were clean, large and well-equiped. the hotel is centrally located, modern and design-oriented. there is an excellent bar and restaurant on site though one is within easy walking distance of numerous central-city restaurants and bars or a taxi/tram ride from haight st / castro / mission. excellent.

review.title: everything was amazing
review.reviewText: Don't forget to order your BLISS products to take home. It helps remind you of your trip.

review.title: Consistently Good
review.reviewText: For those travellers that need that modern synergy, the W is the place to stay. With its' hip bar and lounge as well as young friendly staff, the W offers keeps a low profile but classy act. The XYZ restaurant is superb!!!

review.title: A little hip for me, but good hotel
review.reviewText: Very comfortable hotel for business, well located near financial district. A little put off by lobby bar -- but its nicely isolated from guest areas. Overall, a good four-star.

review.title: Stylish and comfortable with excellent service.
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel. There was a noisy fan in our first room, but we changed rooms with no difficulty. The staff was very helpful and the concierge was excellent. The hotel itself is very stylish but comfort is not sacrificed for the look. In addition, it is very well located at one block from the Moscone Center and Metreon, next door to the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art and just a few blocks from Union Square. We will return to this hotel and would recommend it to friends and business associates alike.

review.title: Top Notch
review.reviewText: Very impressed would reccomend to family and friends will be back for a stay real soon.

review.title: Worst Customer Service Attitude
review.reviewText: The customer servise associates at check-in completely ignored customers while they weree chatting about other stuff. Hotel housekeeping is good and clean, but very loud. False fire alarms were tgriggered in th emiddle of the night several times. Extremely loud speakers in hallways. Avoid if you can.

review.title: A great hotel, if you don't want to work out
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful, wildly pretentious hotel. The bed is lovely, the decor stunning. Broadband internet is at your fingertips (for a price). The staff is knowledgeable and attentive. The only drawback--and it is significant--is the fitness room. I have seen better fitness rooms in 2-star hotels. There is one multipurpose weight rack, a small rack of dumbbells, and no room to use any of it. The cardio equipment is serviceable, but be prepared to come in close contact with your sweaty neighbors. They are currently upgrading the room to add a Bliss spa, which will create a nice spa, but will do nothing to improve the workout facility.

review.title: Pleased
review.reviewText: The staff was prompt, helpful and courteous, and more importantly to us, good natured with our young children. There are many attractions near the hotel for all age groups.

review.title: Bad Hotel
review.reviewText: Poor physical condition (chipped furniture, dirty carpets) Cramped rooms Mediocre service $45/day parking charge

review.title: Nice hotel with arrogant staff
review.reviewText: Like all W Hotels, the W in San Francisco is a beautiful environment with a trendy bar area, decent restaurant and small, but beautifully modern rooms. This trendy hotel's staff , unfortunately, resonates a similar arrogance to what you would find among doormen at the city's trendy clubs. This place would be 5 out of 5 if only the emplyees behind the check-in counter could crack a smile.

review.title: Hipster style meets gracious service
review.reviewText: I always knew that W hotels had a great deal of style, but I was also pleasantly surpised by the great service we received from virtually everyone we encountered. The room itself was likewise fantastic -- having a window seat with a full view of downtown San Francisco is a real treat (even for someone that has lived there). I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the W San Francisco to anyone, whether you're a "hipster" or simply appreciate modern design and a gracious staff.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The W San Francisco was great.  Would definitely recommend.
